articles.description: Jack Leach takes the three wickets England require for a record-breaking win over Pakistan and a 1-0 lead in the three-match series.
articles.title: Pakistan vs England: Jack Leach seals record-breaking win in Multan

articles.description: Lee Carsley's time as interim England boss ends on 17 November - so who are the contenders to be named next permanent manager?
articles.title: Carsley? Guardiola? Howe? Klopp? McKenna? Tuchel? - Who will be next permanent England manager?

articles.description: Cristiano Ronaldo remains a key member of Portugal's squad. BBC Sport looks at his role with the national team.
articles.title: Cristiano Ronaldo: Portugal forward's quest for 1,000 goals continues

articles.description: Australia all but secure their place in the semi-finals of the Women's T20 World Cup with a ruthless nine-wicket win over Pakistan in Dubai.
articles.title: Women's T20 World Cup: Australia thrash Pakistan by nine wickets

articles.description: As INEOS Britannia prepares to compete for the 2024 America's Cup, BBC Sport looks at how Great Britain hopes to win sailing's most prestigious competition for the first time.
articles.title: America's Cup: Can Ben Ainslie and INEOS Britannia end Great Britain’s 173-year wait for victory?

articles.description: Stephan Shemilt analyses the talking points after England's first-Test win over Pakistan in Multan.
articles.title: Pakistan vs England: Stokes, Leach, Bashir, Multan pitch and other talking points

articles.description: Conor Benn launched a foul-mouthed tirade at Chris Eubank Jr and pushed his fellow Briton during an altercation in Saudi Arabia.
articles.title: Boxing: Conor Benn pushes Chris Eubank Jr in Saudi Arabia altercation

articles.description: Novak Djokovic's bid to claim a landmark 100th ATP title remains on track as he overcomes Jakub Mensik in the quarter-finals of the Shanghai Masters.
articles.title: Shanghai Masters: Novak Djokovic beats Jakub Mensik to reach semi-finals

articles.description: Wales ran out comfortable winners against Japan to salvage some pride in their WXV2 campaign.
articles.title: Wales outclass Japan to finish WXV2 on a high

articles.description: Nottingham Forest are found guilty of bringing the game into disrepute for their comments about match officials in last season's 2-0 loss at Everton.
articles.title: Nottingham Forest fined £750,000 for Stuart Attwell 'VAR is a Luton fan' social media post
